title: Add OIDC authentication access-token-issuer and prompt properties
body:
### Description

Some providers like Azure Active Directory can set different issuer claims for ID and Access token returned in the code flow. In such cases setting `quarkus.token.access-token-issuer` can be better than setting only `quarkus.token.issuer=any` to cover both ID and access tokens with the different issuers.

Additionally, while discussing #23053, I thought I'd help users to do `quarkus.oidc.authentication.prompt=consent` (with values correctness enforced by enums) instead of asking them to do `quarkus.oidc.authentication.extra-params.prompt=consent`, goven that `prompt` is a well known OIDC parameter with well-defined values
